---
title: 'Chapter 6 - Binomial Regression'
subtitle: 'Moth Coloration and Natural Selection'
categories: ["⚠️ Warning: Page Under Revision"]
---

## Setup 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```

Attaching package: 'dplyr'
```

```

    filter, lag
```

```
The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(readr)
library(ggplot2)
library(gridExtra) 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```

Attaching package: 'gridExtra'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr':

    combine
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
moth <- read_csv("data/moth.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 14 Columns: 4
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): MORPH
dbl (3): DISTANCE, PLACED, REMOVED

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
moth <- mutate(moth, notremoved = PLACED - REMOVED, 
               logit1 = log(REMOVED / notremoved),
               prop1 = REMOVED / PLACED, 
               dark = ifelse(MORPH=="dark",1,0) )

moth |> head(5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 5 × 8
  MORPH DISTANCE PLACED REMOVED notremoved logit1 prop1  dark
  <chr>    <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>      <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
1 light      0       56      17         39 -0.830 0.304     0
2 dark       0       56      14         42 -1.10  0.25      1
3 light      7.2     80      28         52 -0.619 0.35      0
4 dark       7.2     80      20         60 -1.10  0.25      1
5 light     24.1     52      18         34 -0.636 0.346     0
```


:::
:::




### Code Exercises 0-3



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# EDA
ggplot(data = moth, aes(x = DISTANCE, y = logit1)) + 
  geom_point() + geom_smooth(method="lm") 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](04_moths_fillable_files/figure-html/eda-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = moth, aes(x = MORPH, y = logit1)) + 
  geom_boxplot() 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](04_moths_fillable_files/figure-html/eda-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Plot empirical logits vs. distance separately by morph
ggplot(data = moth, aes(x = DISTANCE, y = logit1, color = MORPH, 
                        shape = MORPH)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method="lm", alpha = 1/4) 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](04_moths_fillable_files/figure-html/eda-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Repeat above plot but "Connect the dots" within morph
ggplot(data = moth, aes(x = DISTANCE, y = logit1, color = MORPH, 
                        shape = MORPH)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_line() 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](04_moths_fillable_files/figure-html/eda-4.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Code Exercises 3-5


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Initial model
breg2 <- glm(prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark, weights = PLACED, family = binomial, 
             data = moth)
summary(breg2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
glm(formula = prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark, family = binomial, data = moth, 
    weights = PLACED)

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
(Intercept) -1.136742   0.156758  -7.252 4.12e-13 ***
DISTANCE     0.005314   0.004002   1.328  0.18422    
dark         0.404052   0.139377   2.899  0.00374 ** 
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 35.385  on 13  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 25.161  on 11  degrees of freedom
AIC: 93.836

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
exp(coef(breg2))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
(Intercept)    DISTANCE        dark 
  0.3208626   1.0053278   1.4978822 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Alternative way to express initial model
breg2a <- glm(cbind(REMOVED, notremoved) ~ DISTANCE + dark, 
              family = binomial, data=moth)
summary(breg2a)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
glm(formula = cbind(REMOVED, notremoved) ~ DISTANCE + dark, family = binomial, 
    data = moth)

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
(Intercept) -1.136742   0.156758  -7.252 4.12e-13 ***
DISTANCE     0.005314   0.004002   1.328  0.18422    
dark         0.404052   0.139377   2.899  0.00374 ** 
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 35.385  on 13  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 25.161  on 11  degrees of freedom
AIC: 93.836

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
```


:::
:::




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Yet one more way to express initial model
breg2b <- glm(prop1 ~ DISTANCE + MORPH, weights = PLACED, family = binomial, data = moth)
summary(breg2b)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
glm(formula = prop1 ~ DISTANCE + MORPH, family = binomial, data = moth, 
    weights = PLACED)

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
(Intercept) -0.732690   0.151221  -4.845 1.27e-06 ***
DISTANCE     0.005314   0.004002   1.328  0.18422    
MORPHlight  -0.404052   0.139377  -2.899  0.00374 ** 
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 35.385  on 13  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 25.161  on 11  degrees of freedom
AIC: 93.836

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
```


:::
:::


### Code Exercises 6-9



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Plot initial model (no interaction)
moth <- mutate(moth, breg2.pred = predict(breg2, type="link") )
ggplot(data = moth, aes(x = DISTANCE, color = MORPH, shape = MORPH)) + 
  geom_point(aes(y = logit1)) + 
  geom_smooth(aes(y = breg2.pred), method="lm") +
  ggtitle("Initial model (no interaction)")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](04_moths_fillable_files/figure-html/predictions_coef-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Model with interaction (full model)
breg3 <- glm(prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark + DISTANCE:dark, weights = PLACED, 
             family = binomial, data = moth)
summary(breg3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
glm(formula = prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark + DISTANCE:dark, family = binomial, 
    data = moth, weights = PLACED)

Coefficients:
               Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
(Intercept)   -0.717729   0.190205  -3.773 0.000161 ***
DISTANCE      -0.009287   0.005788  -1.604 0.108629    
dark          -0.411257   0.274490  -1.498 0.134066    
DISTANCE:dark  0.027789   0.008085   3.437 0.000588 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 35.385  on 13  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 13.230  on 10  degrees of freedom
AIC: 83.904

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Interpret exponentiated coefficients and associated profile CIs
exp(coef(breg3))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  (Intercept)      DISTANCE          dark DISTANCE:dark 
    0.4878587     0.9907562     0.6628165     1.0281788 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
exp(confint(breg3))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Waiting for profiling to be done...
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                  2.5 %    97.5 %
(Intercept)   0.3335844 0.7042152
DISTANCE      0.9795673 1.0020840
dark          0.3860419 1.1340516
DISTANCE:dark 1.0120693 1.0446879
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Generate CIs - Wald-based method
betas <- summary(breg3)$coefficients[,1]
sebetas <- summary(breg3)$coefficients[,2]
lb <- betas - qnorm(.975)*sebetas
ub <- betas + qnorm(.975)*sebetas
cbind(exp(lb),exp(ub))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                   [,1]      [,2]
(Intercept)   0.3360403 0.7082667
DISTANCE      0.9795796 1.0020603
dark          0.3870322 1.1351139
DISTANCE:dark 1.0120134 1.0446024
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Drop in deviance test
anova(breg2, breg3, test="Chisq")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Analysis of Deviance Table

Model 1: prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark
Model 2: prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark + DISTANCE:dark
  Resid. Df Resid. Dev Df Deviance  Pr(>Chi)    
1        11     25.161                          
2        10     13.230  1   11.931 0.0005519 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Test goodness of fit for full model
gof <- 1-pchisq(breg3$deviance, breg3$df.residual)
gof  
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.2111003
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Plot full model (with interaction)
moth <- mutate(moth, breg3.pred = predict(breg3, type="link") )
ggplot(data = moth, aes(x = DISTANCE, color = MORPH, shape = MORPH)) + 
  geom_point(aes(y = logit1)) + 
  geom_smooth(aes(y = breg3.pred), method="lm") +
  ggtitle("Full model (with interaction)")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](04_moths_fillable_files/figure-html/model_breg3-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Construct table of predicted values and prediction errors
bin.prop = moth$prop1
model.est = predict(breg3, type="response")
dev.resid = residuals(breg3, type="deviance")
pears.resid = residuals(breg3, type="pearson")
display1 = data.frame(DISTANCE=moth$DISTANCE, MORPH=moth$MORPH, bin.prop, 
  model.est, dev.resid, pears.resid)
display1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   DISTANCE MORPH  bin.prop model.est   dev.resid pears.resid
1       0.0 light 0.3035714 0.3278932 -0.39029161 -0.38770684
2       0.0  dark 0.2500000 0.2443482  0.09817395  0.09842764
3       7.2 light 0.3500000 0.3133306  0.70012843  0.70708882
4       7.2  dark 0.2500000 0.2697738 -0.40168046 -0.39848098
5      24.1 light 0.3461538 0.2805892  1.03033392  1.05231913
6      24.1  dark 0.4230769 0.3355738  1.31241839  1.33631238
7      30.2 light 0.1500000 0.2692974 -2.21182753 -2.08314815
8      30.2  dark 0.2666667 0.3611865 -1.56021941 -1.52421287
9      36.4 light 0.2666667 0.2581190  0.15076812  0.15130310
10     36.4  dark 0.3833333 0.3880529 -0.07507580 -0.07501947
11     41.5 light 0.2380952 0.2491537 -0.23551483 -0.23432889
12     41.5  dark 0.4761905 0.4106830  1.21248773  1.22040170
13     51.2 light 0.2608696 0.2326848  0.63131047  0.63978903
14     51.2  dark 0.4239130 0.4547068 -0.59447466 -0.59316567
```


:::
:::


### Code Exercises 10-11



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Adjusting for extra-binomial variation (overdispersion)
breg4 <- glm(prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark + DISTANCE:dark, weights = PLACED,
             family = quasibinomial, data = moth)
summary(breg4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
glm(formula = prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark + DISTANCE:dark, family = quasibinomial, 
    data = moth, weights = PLACED)

Coefficients:
               Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)   
(Intercept)   -0.717729   0.214423  -3.347   0.0074 **
DISTANCE      -0.009287   0.006525  -1.423   0.1851   
dark          -0.411257   0.309439  -1.329   0.2134   
DISTANCE:dark  0.027789   0.009115   3.049   0.0123 * 
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for quasibinomial family taken to be 1.270859)

    Null deviance: 35.385  on 13  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 13.230  on 10  degrees of freedom
AIC: NA

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
exp(coef(breg4))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  (Intercept)      DISTANCE          dark DISTANCE:dark 
    0.4878587     0.9907562     0.6628165     1.0281788 
```


:::
:::




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Adjusted drop in deviance test
breg4a <- glm(prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark, weights = PLACED,
              family = quasibinomial, data = moth)
summary(breg4a)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
glm(formula = prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark, family = quasibinomial, 
    data = moth, weights = PLACED)

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept) -1.136742   0.235365  -4.830 0.000528 ***
DISTANCE     0.005314   0.006008   0.884 0.395404    
dark         0.404052   0.209269   1.931 0.079680 .  
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for quasibinomial family taken to be 2.25436)

    Null deviance: 35.385  on 13  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 25.161  on 11  degrees of freedom
AIC: NA

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(breg4a, breg4, test = "F")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Analysis of Deviance Table

Model 1: prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark
Model 2: prop1 ~ DISTANCE + dark + DISTANCE:dark
  Resid. Df Resid. Dev Df Deviance      F  Pr(>F)  
1        11     25.161                             
2        10     13.230  1   11.931 9.3885 0.01196 *
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Find phi = overdispersion parrameter
phi.num = sum(pears.resid^2)
phi.denom = breg3$df.residual   # equals 14-4
phihat = phi.num / phi.denom
phihat
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1.270859
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
sqrt(phihat)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1.127324
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Significance tests for interaction term after adjust for overdispersion
dropindev = breg2$deviance - breg3$deviance
d = breg2$df.residual - breg3$df.residual
Fstat = (dropindev/d) / phihat
pval = 1-pf(Fstat, d, breg3$df.residual)
Fstat
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 9.388515
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pval    # p-value from adjusted Drop in Deviance test
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.01196119
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
beta = summary(breg4)$coefficients[4,1]
sebeta = summary(breg4)$coefficients[4,2]
tstat = beta / sebeta
pval = 2*(1-pt(tstat, breg4$df.residual))
tstat
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 3.048731
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
pval    # p-value from adjusted Wald test
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.01227827
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Generate adjusted CIs - profile likelihood method
exp(confint(breg4))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Waiting for profiling to be done...
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                  2.5 %    97.5 %
(Intercept)   0.3174445 0.7373944
DISTANCE      0.9781472 1.0035420
dark          0.3601859 1.2143078
DISTANCE:dark 1.0100422 1.0468234
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Generate adjusted CIs - Wald-based method
qlcoef = summary(breg4)$coefficients[,1]
qlse = summary(breg4)$coefficients[,2]
lb = qlcoef - qt(.975,breg4$df.residual)*qlse
ub = qlcoef + qt(.975,breg4$df.residual)*qlse
cbind(exp(lb),exp(ub))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                   [,1]      [,2]
(Intercept)   0.3025549 0.7866545
DISTANCE      0.9764554 1.0052664
dark          0.3326282 1.3207711
DISTANCE:dark 1.0075077 1.0492739
```


:::
:::




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Note relationships between betas and SE(betas) under maximum 
# likelihood (sebetas) and quasi likelihood (qlse):
qlse
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  (Intercept)      DISTANCE          dark DISTANCE:dark 
  0.214422569   0.006525361   0.309438917   0.009114954 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
sebetas
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  (Intercept)      DISTANCE          dark DISTANCE:dark 
  0.190204947   0.005788365   0.274489822   0.008085480 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
sqrt(phihat)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1.127324
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
sebetas*sqrt(phihat)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  (Intercept)      DISTANCE          dark DISTANCE:dark 
  0.214422569   0.006525361   0.309438916   0.009114954 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qlcoef
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  (Intercept)      DISTANCE          dark DISTANCE:dark 
 -0.717729416  -0.009286783  -0.411257136   0.027789044 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
betas
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  (Intercept)      DISTANCE          dark DISTANCE:dark 
 -0.717729416  -0.009286783  -0.411257136   0.027789044 
```

### Exercises 12 and 13


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Distance as factor variable
moth <- mutate(moth, location = as.factor(DISTANCE) )
breg5 = glm(prop1 ~ location + dark, weights = PLACED, 
            family = binomial, data = moth)
summary(breg5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
glm(formula = prop1 ~ location + dark, family = binomial, data = moth, 
    weights = PLACED)

Coefficients:
             Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
(Intercept)   -1.1739     0.2254  -5.207 1.92e-07 ***
location7.2    0.1141     0.2739   0.417  0.67686    
location24.1   0.4950     0.2933   1.688  0.09148 .  
location30.2  -0.3774     0.3096  -1.219  0.22287    
location36.4   0.2316     0.2886   0.802  0.42236    
location41.5   0.3760     0.2667   1.410  0.15864    
location51.2   0.3105     0.2633   1.179  0.23829    
dark           0.4083     0.1401   2.914  0.00357 ** 
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 35.385  on 13  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 14.774  on  6  degrees of freedom
AIC: 93.449

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4
```


:::
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
breg5a = glm(prop1 ~ location + dark + location:dark, weights = PLACED,
            family = binomial, data = moth)
summary(breg5a)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
glm(formula = prop1 ~ location + dark + location:dark, family = binomial, 
    data = moth, weights = PLACED)

Coefficients:
                  Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)   
(Intercept)        -0.8303     0.2906  -2.857  0.00428 **
location7.2         0.2113     0.3734   0.566  0.57143   
location24.1        0.1944     0.4116   0.472  0.63680   
location30.2       -0.9043     0.4639  -1.949  0.05126 .
```

```{.r .cell-code}
# Try running as logistic regression.  
#    First must expand data to one row per moth.
mtemp1 = rep(moth$dark[1],moth$REMOVED[1])
dtemp1 = rep(moth$DISTANCE[1],moth$REMOVED[1])
rtemp1 = rep(1,moth$REMOVED[1])
mtemp1 = c(mtemp1,rep(moth$dark[1],moth$PLACED[1]-moth$REMOVED[1]))
dtemp1 = c(dtemp1,rep(moth$DISTANCE[1],moth$PLACED[1]-moth$REMOVED[1]))
rtemp1 = c(rtemp1,rep(0,moth$PLACED[1]-moth$REMOVED[1]))
for(i in 2:14)  {
  mtemp1 = c(mtemp1,rep(moth$dark[i],moth$REMOVED[i]))
  dtemp1 = c(dtemp1,rep(moth$DISTANCE[i],moth$REMOVED[i]))
  rtemp1 = c(rtemp1,rep(1,moth$REMOVED[i]))
  mtemp1 = c(mtemp1,rep(moth$dark[i],moth$PLACED[i]-moth$REMOVED[i]))
  dtemp1 = c(dtemp1,rep(moth$DISTANCE[i],moth$PLACED[i]-moth$REMOVED[i]))
  rtemp1 = c(rtemp1,rep(0,moth$PLACED[i]-moth$REMOVED[i]))  }
newdata = data.frame(removed=rtemp1,dark=mtemp1,dist=dtemp1)
newdata[1:25,]
```

```{.r .cell-code}
id1 = as.factor(dtemp1)
model1 = glmer(rtemp1 ~ mtemp1 + dtemp1 + mtemp1:dtemp1 + (1|id1), family=binomial)
summary(model1)
```
